document.masterDocTitle: Pamphagidae (Orthoptera: Acridoidea) from the Palaearctic Region: taxonomy, classification, keys to genera and a review of the tribe Nocarodeini I. Bolívar

rubripes
) ( MNCN )
;
Gamsun [ Samsun ], 1♂ (leg. Steindachner ) ( NMW )
.
Distribution. Central part of N. Turkey : Çorum , Amasya , Tokat , Samsun provinces ( Fig. 846 ).

Coloration. Body brown with many small cream and black spots. Ventral half of head, fore and mid legs and antenna light brown; dorsal surface of head blackened except the cream basal part of median carinula of vertex. Pronotum with small cream and black tubercles; typical light band on paranota creamish-brown. Typical light band on abdomen distinct; lateral surface of abdomen dark brown. Outer surfaces of hind femur and tibia light creamishbrown with small dark spots; inner and ventral surfaces of hind femur blackened, dorsal margin of inner surface body color. Inner surface and inner half of dorsal surface of hind tibia orange, turning to reddish-orange apically with black tipped spines, outer half of dorsal surface yellow with outer spines, in one male tibia yellow without orange. Tarsus reddish-orange. Sternites light brownish-cream or yellowish-cream; anterior margins of abdominal sternites and subgenital plate with a distinct brown band transversally.

Measurements (mm) of both sexes. body length: male 21–23.8, female 36–37.8; pronotum length: male 4.6– 4.9, female 7.1–8.2; pronotum height: male 4.8–5.3, female 8.5–9.6; pronotum width anterior: male 4.3–4.5, female 6.7–7.2; pronotum width posterior: male 5.9–6.4, female 9.6–10.6; hind femur length: male 8.6–9, female 12.4–14.5; hind femur height: male 3.3–3.7, female 4.7–5.2.

Remarks. Ramme (1951: 301) described a new form
N. bodenheimeri
f. flavipes which is undoubtedly conspecific with
N. sabulosus
by the orange or yellow hind tibia, the compressed body laterally, the roof-shaped pronotum without or with weak lateral carinae, some of which are the reasons of its placement in the
N. tridentatus
sp. group while
N. bodenheimeri Uvarov
is placed in another species group (see the key).

Demirsoy (1973 , 1977 ) cited this species as “( Ramme 1951: 304 )” with its type locality “ Çorum ” for two taxa,
Paranocaracris citripes sabulosa Ramme
( Demirsoy 1973 : 423; 1977: 79) and
Paranocaracris rubripes burri f. acarinata
( Demirsoy 1973 : 426; 1977: 83). While the Çorum population belongs to
N. sabulosus
, the specimens from Ilgaz Dağı belong to
Nocararis niethammeri Ramme, 1951
.
The previously unknown male is described here.
According to the ICZN (Articles 31.2, 34.2) the species name of this taxon is combined.
